guide: A stacked area chart is a type of area chart that compares how its specific components change over time in comparison to one another.
Each color represents a different component being measured in the chart, and the height of each
component represents the value of each component. As you move along the x-axis, the heights of each
component change, and you see how each one increases or decreases over time. The increasing
components will increase in size and the decreasing components will decrease in size and this chart
makes it easy to visualize the proportions of each component to the overall total.
